statsguruLinks.title: 100-stands by India v SA in chases
Top scores in chases v SA

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers not out 104 (73b 5x4 6x6 116m) SR: 142.46
Faf du Plessis lbw b Yadav 62 (77b 5x4 1x6 93m) SR: 80.51

dismissalComment.html: lbw! Umesh returns and gets the ball to jag into the right-hander from outside off, the umpire had his finger up in a flash. That ball hit the pad before the bat and it looks pretty adjacent. Looks like there is some reverse swing on offer, du Plessis played the wrong line because of the sharp movement into him, he was looking to guide it to third man

headshotImage.caption: Amit Mishra player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Amit Mishra player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Mishra bowls the faster one that goes straight on, zipping through Amla's defences as he goes back to play the ball on the leg side. Clearly beaten by the change in pace. The ball deflects off the pad and hits the stumps

Miller's been stumped by a mile! He charged Mishra to try and hit him for six over the leg side but was beaten by the dipping legbreak that spun towards him and went through the gap between bat and body, Dhoni had so much time to break the stumps, Miller did not even try to make it back

lbw! Umesh returns and gets the ball to jag into the right-hander from outside off, the umpire had his finger up in a flash. That ball hit the pad before the bat and it looks pretty adjacent. Looks like there is some reverse swing on offer, du Plessis played the wrong line because of the sharp movement into him, he was looking to guide it to third man
and once again he strikes first ball! Duminy chased a very wide ball with a slash - no footwork - and gets a thin edge through to Dhoni. Ordinary ball, ordinary shot, simple catch

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Raina b Ashwin 29 (33b 5x4 0x6 37m) SR: 87.87

dismissalComment.html: that's a ripper and he's been caught at slip! From around the wicket, Ashwin drifted the ball into the left-hander with teasing flight, he pitched the ball on middle, drawing de Kock into a forward defence with his length, the ball then spun sharply away, taking the outside edge and Raina took a low catch at slip

headshotImage.caption: Amit Mishra player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Amit Mishra player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla b Mishra 37 (59b 3x4 0x6 96m) SR: 62.71

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Mishra bowls the faster one that goes straight on, zipping through Amla's defences as he goes back to play the ball on the leg side. Clearly beaten by the change in pace. The ball deflects off the pad and hits the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis lbw b Yadav 62 (77b 5x4 1x6 93m) SR: 80.51

dismissalComment.html: lbw! Umesh returns and gets the ball to jag into the right-hander from outside off, the umpire had his finger up in a flash. That ball hit the pad before the bat and it looks pretty adjacent. Looks like there is some reverse swing on offer, du Plessis played the wrong line because of the sharp movement into him, he was looking to guide it to third man

headshotImage.caption: Amit Mishra player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Amit Mishra player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller st Dhoni b Mishra 13 (22b 0x4 0x6 37m) SR: 59.09

dismissalComment.html: Miller's been stumped by a mile! He charged Mishra to try and hit him for six over the leg side but was beaten by the dipping legbreak that spun towards him and went through the gap between bat and body, Dhoni had so much time to break the stumps, Miller did not even try to make it back

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c Dhoni b Yadav 15 (17b 0x4 1x6 21m) SR: 88.23

dismissalComment.html: and once again he strikes first ball! Duminy chased a very wide ball with a slash - no footwork - and gets a thin edge through to Dhoni. Ordinary ball, ordinary shot, simple catch

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma c & b Imran Tahir 150 (133b 13x4 6x6 215m) SR: 112.78

dismissalComment.html: he's been caught and bowled! Rohit stepped out of his crease but was beaten by the flight of the legbreak, he wasn't to the pitch of the ball and ended up punching it tamely right back at Tahir, who sets off on an epic celebratory run after taking the catch. He'll tire himself out on such a hot day!

dismissalText.commentary: Ajinkya Rahane c Miller b Behardien 60 (82b 5x4 0x6 117m) SR: 73.17

dismissalComment.html: a soft dismissal to break the stand! Rahane made room by moving outside leg and slapped an innocuous delivery straight to Miller at extra cover. His partnership with Rohit ends on 149

he's been caught and bowled! Rohit stepped out of his crease but was beaten by the flight of the legbreak, he wasn't to the pitch of the ball and ended up punching it tamely right back at Tahir, who sets off on an epic celebratory run after taking the catch. He'll tire himself out on such a hot day!

Tahir has got another one! Raina has barely had a chance to get his eye in but he can't afford to either. He aims to slam a googly over the midwicket boundary and ends up mis-hitting it towards long on, where Duminy takes the catch

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Dhoni has been caught and bowled! This is an innings that will be discussed for a while now. He's charged the young fast bowler and aimed a slog across the line, he top edged the ball high in the air and Rabada calls for it coolly and takes the catch. Dhoni fails to see India through, they need seven off two balls.

Rabada has all but done it for South Africa! Binny also too edges the pull and skies the catch to square leg, Rabada tries to go for it himself again, but leaves it to Amla who comes running in to catch it.

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan lbw b Morkel 23 (28b 5x4 0x6 33m) SR: 82.14

dismissalComment.html: given lbw! But was that missing leg? The ball was quite full from round the wicket, angling into the left-hander. Dhawan was caught on the crease and hit on the pad as he looked to play on the leg side. Morkel went up immediately, and the umpire followed after a short pause ... it did look like that would have missed leg stump, or just about clipped it.

dismissalText.commentary: Ajinkya Rahane c Miller b Behardien 60 (82b 5x4 0x6 117m) SR: 73.17

dismissalComment.html: a soft dismissal to break the stand! Rahane made room by moving outside leg and slapped an innocuous delivery straight to Miller at extra cover. His partnership with Rohit ends on 149

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli c Morkel b Steyn 11 (18b 0x4 0x6 29m) SR: 61.11

dismissalComment.html: has he been caught at short fine leg? What a take! Steyn bowled a half-volley on the pads, a delivery Kohli should have put away. He flicked the ball uppishly but it was dying on the tall Morne Morkel at short fine leg. Morkel got down low and caught the ball in his fingertips before it hit the ground. Is the tide turning decisively now?

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma c & b Imran Tahir 150 (133b 13x4 6x6 215m) SR: 112.78

dismissalComment.html: he's been caught and bowled! Rohit stepped out of his crease but was beaten by the flight of the legbreak, he wasn't to the pitch of the ball and ended up punching it tamely right back at Tahir, who sets off on an epic celebratory run after taking the catch. He'll tire himself out on such a hot day!

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina c Duminy b Imran Tahir 3 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Tahir has got another one! Raina has barely had a chance to get his eye in but he can't afford to either. He aims to slam a googly over the midwicket boundary and ends up mis-hitting it towards long on, where Duminy takes the catch

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: MS Dhoni c & b Rabada 31 (30b 1x4 0x6 54m) SR: 103.33

dismissalComment.html: Dhoni has been caught and bowled! This is an innings that will be discussed for a while now. He's charged the young fast bowler and aimed a slog across the line, he top edged the ball high in the air and Rabada calls for it coolly and takes the catch. Dhoni fails to see India through, they need seven off two balls.

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Stuart Binny c Amla b Rabada 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: Rabada has all but done it for South Africa! Binny also too edges the pull and skies the catch to square leg, Rabada tries to go for it himself again, but leaves it to Amla who comes running in to catch it.

headshotImage.caption: Amit Mishra player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Amit Mishra player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentPreTextItems.html: India need six off the final ball to tie the game. AB did it for SA. Can Rabada take his second ODI hat-trick? India have had a shambolic finish to their chase that seemed to be going so well. Tahir and Rabada have been superb.

commentTextItems.html: the final ball is limply hit past the bowler for a single. Rabada stands tall in a high pressure situation, defending 11 in the final over to give South Africa a 1-0 lead

commentPostTextItems.html: 5.05 pm India were cruising the chase when Rohit and Rahane were batting, but after Rahane was dismissed Rohit appeared to be doing all the run-making. And once Tahir got him out, the rustiness of the rest of India's batsmen shone through. South Africa have pulled off an impressive squeeze, and can thank Tahir and Rabada, who delivered at critical junctures.

Nakul: "South Africa haven't won this match. Dhoni has given it away to them. Why come ahead of Raina when you aren't in greater of forms and when Raina can slog better. Put pressure on Rohit instead of releasing it. Disappointed." That's a fair question. Raina came out with no time to settle at all, and was out slogging so early.

Here's South Africa's last-over hero, Kagiso Rabada: "I think I owed that to the team because I dropped Rohit on the boundary. That could have turned out badly. I was feeling a bit of nerves because you have MS Dhoni on the other side, I've been watching him since I was a kid and seen how destructive he is. I'm happy I pulled through today. I wasn't thinking about the hat-trick, there were a lot of things in my mind."
Abhishek: "Feel for poor Rohit who has shone with the bat till now. Two centuries & two losses. Must be feeling gutted!!"

Shantanu: "I'm looking at this a bit differently. Dhoni has lost the ability to hit big shots at will no doubt. But that just means he's more suited to no 4 role now. He can still get a run a ball 50 or 100 just by getting singles and doubles. 3,4,5 have slowed India down."

MS Dhoni: "The outcome was not great for us, there were plenty that went wrong, but we showed character to get close. Frankly we should have won this game ... We missed Ash's six overs that was crucial because he was our best spinner ... until that point the plan was working beautifully but I had to get more overs from Binny and Raina. In the end I thought out bowlers should have done a bit better ... I thought the partnership between Rohit and Rahane was superb to keep it ticking ..."

Dhoni on his innings: "It was a bit difficult, it was not coming at a good height so it becomes difficult on such a wicket, it was a bit two paced once the ball gets scuffed. A lot depends on the execution part, it's not only about the boundaries you have to keep the score ticking ..."
He them goes on to say it doesn't matter how the runs come, whether of his bat or the thigh pad.

AB de Villiers is the man of the match, obviously. AB: "I thought it was an amazing game of cricket, close games like that bring the fans in. There were lots of times when the momentum turned, I thought Tahir's over turned the game on its head, we were out of it then. Rabada proved to be a handful and he's got a bright future ... We just want to go an rest and then move on to the next game." AB looks quite knackered!
koka: "Don't blame Dhoni, The Finisher. With 90 Required off the last 10 overs he made 31(30) and the rest had just done 54(30) and are 5 runs short !!"

Right, that's all I've got for you today. I'm going to give my hands a rest. Stick around for the match report and analysis from a game that is bound to generate quite some debate. Thank you for all your emails. Have a good evening. Cheers.

headshotImage.caption: Amit Mishra player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Amit Mishra player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Stuart Binny c Amla b Rabada 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 40

commentTextItems.html: Rabada has all but done it for South Africa! Binny also too edges the pull and skies the catch to square leg, Rabada tries to go for it himself again, but leaves it to Amla who comes running in to catch it.

dismissalText.commentary: MS Dhoni c & b Rabada 31 (30b 1x4 0x6 54m) SR: 103.33

commentTextItems.html: Dhoni has been caught and bowled! This is an innings that will be discussed for a while now. He's charged the young fast bowler and aimed a slog across the line, he top edged the ball high in the air and Rabada calls for it coolly and takes the catch. Dhoni fails to see India through, they need seven off two balls.
Binny flat bats the ball past Rabada, not timing it well, over to Dhoni now. Seven needed off three balls.
Dhoni charges and is cramped for room as he pulls, the ball goes to deep midwicket, just the single this time, Binny will have the strike

commentPreTextItems.html: Dhoni v Rabada. One batsman against one bowler. 11 to get in the final over. Pressure game. Dhoni seems to have upped his intensity, and some of his timing.

commentTextItems.html: a fumble from Behardien at deep midwicket gives Dhoni the second run and the strike! Dhoni had swiped across the line at a short of a length ball and made good contact

commentPreTextItems.html: Kanpur is chanting their captain's name in unison.

commentTextItems.html: cut hard but Phangiso dives to his left at point and makes a crucial save, that was headed to the boundary

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Dhoni steps out of his crease and slaps the length ball to deep cover, where Amla can't prevent the second
Dhoni finally has a boundary! He moves across towards the off side, gets down low, and scoops the ball from outside off to the fine leg boundary
the full ball swings into the right-hander, Binny drives to long -on

commentPreTextItems.html: Vishwesh: "probably MSD will reduce this Ind vs SA contest to one batsman vs one bowler in the last over like he has done time and over in the past. Whoever blinks first loses."

commentTextItems.html: good length ball angles into Dhoni and he gets hit on the thigh as he tries to turn the ball towards square, they run a leg bye as the ball drops at Dhoni's feet. Dhoni seems to be in a little discomfort, holding his side

commentPreTextItems.html: Prajyot Srivast: "Now please anyone tell me if Indian do not win the match with one man scoring half of the runs required then who is to be blamed!!
Arpit: "It is almost sad to see dhoni batting now. His time is up. Can't time a single ball. Created pressure on Rohit, Raina."

commentTextItems.html: once more Dhoni's legs make up for what his bat can't do, he just taps the ball gently towards midwicket, where the fielder is on the boundary, and sprints through for two ...
good length and straight, Dhoni hits the ball off the front foot to midwicket

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: a length ball on the pads, turned behind square off the pads for a leg bye
dabs it straight to short third man and runs a single

commentPreTextItems.html: Abedi: "I believe the Captain Cool Dhoni will wake up now."

commentTextItems.html: two more! Superb running. Dhoni jumps towards the leg side and cuts the ball through point, the fielder in the deep can't get the ball back quickly enough
played with very soft hands into the midwicket region, which is empty, and the batsmen have fresh legs to sprint back for the second

commentPreTextItems.html: Akhil: "You guys should stop comparing MS to his younger self. With age comes wisdom."
Happy: "What is Dhoni doing? Should target Tahir and he takes a single of the full toss.

commentTextItems.html: turned a length ball off his pads behind square but Morkel fumbles the sliding stop at short fine leg and allows a second
Binny strides forward and defends the final ball of the over. What a finish from Tahir, two wickets and four runs in his tenth over

headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: MS Dhoni c & b Rabada 31 (30b 1x4 0x6 54m) SR: 103.33

dismissalComment.html: Dhoni has been caught and bowled! This is an innings that will be discussed for a while now. He's charged the young fast bowler and aimed a slog across the line, he top edged the ball high in the air and Rabada calls for it coolly and takes the catch. Dhoni fails to see India through, they need seven off two balls.

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina c Duminy b Imran Tahir 3 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Tahir has got another one! Raina has barely had a chance to get his eye in but he can't afford to either. He aims to slam a googly over the midwicket boundary and ends up mis-hitting it towards long on, where Duminy takes the catch

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Stuart Binny c Amla b Rabada 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: Rabada has all but done it for South Africa! Binny also too edges the pull and skies the catch to square leg, Rabada tries to go for it himself again, but leaves it to Amla who comes running in to catch it.

dismissalText.commentary: Bhuvneshwar Kumar not out 1 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 100

headshotImage.caption: Amit Mishra player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Amit Mishra player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Amit Mishra not out 0 (0b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: has he been caught at short fine leg? What a take! Steyn bowled a half-volley on the pads, a delivery Kohli should have put away. He flicked the ball uppishly but it was dying on the tall Morne Morkel at short fine leg. Morkel got down low and caught the ball in his fingertips before it hit the ground. Is the tide turning decisively now?

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Dhoni has been caught and bowled! This is an innings that will be discussed for a while now. He's charged the young fast bowler and aimed a slog across the line, he top edged the ball high in the air and Rabada calls for it coolly and takes the catch. Dhoni fails to see India through, they need seven off two balls.

Rabada has all but done it for South Africa! Binny also too edges the pull and skies the catch to square leg, Rabada tries to go for it himself again, but leaves it to Amla who comes running in to catch it.
a soft dismissal to break the stand! Rahane made room by moving outside leg and slapped an innocuous delivery straight to Miller at extra cover. His partnership with Rohit ends on 149

given lbw! But was that missing leg? The ball was quite full from round the wicket, angling into the left-hander. Dhawan was caught on the crease and hit on the pad as he looked to play on the leg side. Morkel went up immediately, and the umpire followed after a short pause ... it did look like that would have missed leg stump, or just about clipped it.

he's been caught and bowled! Rohit stepped out of his crease but was beaten by the flight of the legbreak, he wasn't to the pitch of the ball and ended up punching it tamely right back at Tahir, who sets off on an epic celebratory run after taking the catch. He'll tire himself out on such a hot day!

Tahir has got another one! Raina has barely had a chance to get his eye in but he can't afford to either. He aims to slam a googly over the midwicket boundary and ends up mis-hitting it towards long on, where Duminy takes the catch

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan lbw b Morkel 23 (28b 5x4 0x6 33m) SR: 82.14

dismissalComment.html: given lbw! But was that missing leg? The ball was quite full from round the wicket, angling into the left-hander. Dhawan was caught on the crease and hit on the pad as he looked to play on the leg side. Morkel went up immediately, and the umpire followed after a short pause ... it did look like that would have missed leg stump, or just about clipped it.

dismissalText.commentary: Ajinkya Rahane c Miller b Behardien 60 (82b 5x4 0x6 117m) SR: 73.17

dismissalComment.html: a soft dismissal to break the stand! Rahane made room by moving outside leg and slapped an innocuous delivery straight to Miller at extra cover. His partnership with Rohit ends on 149

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli c Morkel b Steyn 11 (18b 0x4 0x6 29m) SR: 61.11

dismissalComment.html: has he been caught at short fine leg? What a take! Steyn bowled a half-volley on the pads, a delivery Kohli should have put away. He flicked the ball uppishly but it was dying on the tall Morne Morkel at short fine leg. Morkel got down low and caught the ball in his fingertips before it hit the ground. Is the tide turning decisively now?

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma c & b Imran Tahir 150 (133b 13x4 6x6 215m) SR: 112.78

dismissalComment.html: he's been caught and bowled! Rohit stepped out of his crease but was beaten by the flight of the legbreak, he wasn't to the pitch of the ball and ended up punching it tamely right back at Tahir, who sets off on an epic celebratory run after taking the catch. He'll tire himself out on such a hot day!

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina c Duminy b Imran Tahir 3 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Tahir has got another one! Raina has barely had a chance to get his eye in but he can't afford to either. He aims to slam a googly over the midwicket boundary and ends up mis-hitting it towards long on, where Duminy takes the catch

milestones.description: Hashim Amla has scored 21 hundreds in ODIs, the most for SA breaking Gibbs's record

stories.title: India v South Africa, 2015-16
stories.subTitle: 1st ODI, Kanpur

stories.title: South Africa fined for slow over rate
stories.subTitle: SA in India 2015-16
stories.seoTitle: South Africa fined for slow over rate
stories.summary: South Africa captain AB de Villiers has been fined 40% of his match fee for maintaining a slow over rate during the first ODI against India in Kanpur, while his team-mates were docked 20%

image.caption: AB de Villiers hits over the top
image.longCaption: AB de Villiers hits over the top, India v South Africa, 1st ODI, Kanpur, October 11, 2015

stories.title: Rohit, de Villiers hold their own in Kanpur furnace
stories.subTitle: India v SA, 1st ODI, Kanpur
stories.seoTitle: Rohit, de Villiers hold their own in Kanpur furnace
stories.summary: In the face of testing conditions, Rohit Sharma and AB de Villiers produced memorable hundreds, and on that day, neither was better than the other

image.caption: Rohit Sharma pulls en route to his 150
image.longCaption: Rohit Sharma pulls en route to his 150, India v South Africa, 1st ODI, Kanpur, October 11, 2015

stories.title: Never felt so much pressure before - Rabada
stories.subTitle: India v South Africa, 1st ODI, Kanpur
stories.seoTitle: Never felt so much pressure before - Rabada
stories.summary: Kagiso Rabada has said that he had never felt so much pressure in a game before and that it was crucial for him to keep a clear mind defending in the last over against MS Dhoni

stories.seoTitle: Dhoni takes blame for botched chase
stories.summary: MS Dhoni has said that he was let down by his fast bowlers, who he felt should've "executed the yorkers" better during the death overs

stories.title: Rabada holds his nerve to seal thrilling win for South Africa
stories.subTitle: India v South Africa, 1st ODI, Kanpur

stories.summary: Kanpur saw its two highest ODI totals scored on the same day in a match that seemed to be a mirror image of itself until India cracked

stories.title: Hosts seek fresh start after T20 loss
stories.subTitle: India v South Africa, 1st ODI, Kanpur
stories.seoTitle: Hosts seek fresh start after T20 loss
stories.summary: India have something to prove after their defeat in the T20 series, and South Africa need to build some continuity in the ODI format
